  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GROUND HAZMAT PACKAGE DISCOVERED LEAKING. RESPONDER IN FULL PPE ARRIVED ON SCENE TO FIND A LEAKING PACKAGE ON A CART. AFTER CONSULTING WITH THE BASE LIASON AND THE DECISION TREE, THE RESPONDER CLEANED THE SCENE AND BROUGHT THE CART BACK TO DMP FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025070293
item.description:
Report E-2025070293

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-01
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 1, 2025, fifteen (15) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized granular absorbents, absorbent pads, cleaners, and hand tools to remediate the site. The damaged pails and all impacted materials were containerized in six (6) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025060488
item.description:
Report E-2025060488

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-23
  • City: CALHOUN
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 23, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2920 was forked and released approximately fifty (50) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected the 55-gallon drum and placed it into a 95-gallon over-pack. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted surfaces and neutralized all impacted pallets for future processing. All impacted material was collected and containerized into four (4) 55-gallon drums

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2025, two (2) 1-gallon jugs of UN3469 were punctured and released approximately 0.5-gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the dock floor. The damaged pails were collected in a drum liner, and all impacted materials were containerized in an additional drum liner. Both (2) liners were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

It was reported that approximately 1 pint of acrylic polyurethane sanding surfaces released from a metal pail due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the concrete dock. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.

item.title: Report E-2025060416
item.description:
Report E-2025060416

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-18
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On June 19, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1760 was punctured and released approximately 135-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. HES personnel deployed neutralizing, granular absorbents to the released product, worked them in, and collected the spent absorbents with hand tools. The contents of the damaged tote were transferred into one (1) new 275-gallon tote. The damaged tote was cut up for waste. All impacted materials were containerized in six (6) 55-gallon drums.

  • Description: On June 17, 2025, two (2) 55-pound bags of UN2680 fell in transit and released approximately twenty (20) pounds of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized hand tools to collect the released product, then used absorbent pads and cleaning agents to wipe down the dock floor. The damaged bags were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum, and the collected product and miscellaneous waste were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon pail.

All insulation impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon pail for future terminal disposal.
